meanings.definition: To lift or raise by pushing from behind or below.
meanings.sent1: She was boosting her friend onto the stage.
meanings.sent2: The weightlifter was boosting the heavy barbell above his head.
meanings.sent3: The little girl tried boosting her toy elephant onto the high shelf.
meanings.sent4: The elevator was boosting us to the top floor with great speed.
meanings.sent5: The rocket engines were boosting the spacecraft into orbit.

meanings.sent1: The company was boosting its sales with new marketing strategies.
meanings.sent2: Eating healthy food can help in boosting your energy levels.
meanings.sent3: The magician claimed he could boost the audience's happiness with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent4: The sunshine was boosting the mood of everyone at the picnic.
meanings.sent5: A good night's sleep can do wonders for boosting your immune system.

meanings.sent1: The charity event was boosting awareness for the cause.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was boosting the students' confidence with encouraging words.
meanings.sent3: The coach was boosting the team's morale before the big game.
meanings.sent4: The mentor was boosting the mentee's career with valuable advice.
meanings.sent5: The community was boosting the local economy by shopping at small businesses.
